title: SQLite Default Value Authorization Bypass Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of SQLite. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of DEFAULT expressions for column values.  The issue lies in the ability to create a table that will execute privileged functions by specifying a DEFAULT value for a column and then inserting into the table.  An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute restricted SQL statements under the context of the current process.
addtionnal_details: SQLite has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://support.apple.com/kb/HT201222
timeline:
2015-05-18 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2015-07-01 - Coordinated public release of advisory
